==Events==
* [[590]] &ndash; Emperor [[Maurice (emperor)|Maurice]] proclaims his son [[Theodosius (son of Maurice)|Theodosius]] as co-emperor of the [[Byzantine Empire]].
*[[1027]] &ndash; [[Pope John XIX]] crowns [[Conrad II, Holy Roman Emperor|Conrad II]] as [[Holy Roman Emperor]].
*[[1169]] &ndash; [[Saladin]] becomes the [[emir]] of Egypt.
*[[1344]] &ndash; The [[Siege of Algeciras (1342–1344)|Siege of Algeciras]], one of the first European military engagements where gunpowder was used, comes to an end.
*[[1351]] &ndash; [[Combat of the Thirty]] : Thirty [[Duchy of Brittany|Breton]] Knights call out and defeat thirty English Knights.
*[[1484]] &ndash; [[William Caxton]] prints his translation of ''[[Aesop's Fables]]''.
*[[1552]] &ndash; [[Guru Amar Das]] becomes the Third [[Sikh Guru]].
*[[1636]] &ndash; [[Utrecht University]] is founded in the [[Netherlands]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; An [[1812 Caracas earthquake|earthquake]] destroys [[Caracas]], [[Venezuela]].
*  1812   &ndash; A political cartoon in the ''[[Boston Gazette]]'' coins the term "[[gerrymander]]" to describe oddly shaped [[electoral district]]s designed to help incumbents win reelection.
*[[1830]] &ndash; The [[Book of Mormon]] is published in [[Palmyra (town), New York|Palmyra, New York]].
*[[1839]] &ndash; The first [[Henley Royal Regatta]] is held.
*[[1881]] &ndash; [[Thessaly]] is freed<!-- from whom? --> and becomes part of [[Greece]] again.
*[[1885]] &ndash; The [[Métis people (Canada)|Métis]] people of the [[District of Saskatchewan]] under [[Louis Riel]] begin the [[North-West Rebellion]] against [[Canada]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Balkan War]]: [[Bulgaria]]n forces [[Battle of Adrianople (1913)|capture]] [[Adrianople]].
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[Ice Hockey]]: The [[Vancouver Millionaires]] sweep the [[Ottawa Senators (original)|Ottawa Senators]] three-games-to-none to win the [[1915 Stanley Cup Finals]], the first championship played between the [[Pacific Coast Hockey Association]] and the [[National Hockey Association]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[First Battle of Gaza]] &ndash; [[United Kingdom|British]] troops are halted after 17,000 [[Turkish people|Turks]] block their advance.
*[[1931]] &ndash; [[SwissAir]] is founded as the [[national airline]] of Switzerland.
*1931 &ndash; [[Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union]] is founded in [[Vietnam]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; The [[United Kingdom driving test|driving test]] is introduced in the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[Spanish Civil War]]: [[Francoist Spain|Nationalists]] begin their [[Final offensive of the Spanish Civil War|final offensive]] of the war.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The first female prisoners arrive at [[Auschwitz]] [[Nazi concentration camps|concentration camp]] in [[Polish areas annexed by Nazi Germany|German-occupied Poland]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Battle of Iwo Jima]] ends as the island is officially secured by American forces.
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[United States Army]] launches [[Explorer 3]].
*  1958   &ndash; The [[African Regroupment Party]] is launched at a meeting in [[Paris]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; Ten thousand people gather for one of many [[Central Park be-in]]s in New York City
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[East Pakistan]] declares its independence from [[Pakistan]] to form the [[People's Republic of Bangladesh]] and the [[Bangladesh Liberation War]] begins.
*[[1974]] &ndash; Gaura Devi leads a group of 27 women of Laata village, Henwalghati, Garhwal [[Himalayas]], to form circles around trees to stop them being felled and giving rise to the [[Chipko Movement]] in [[India]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[Biological Weapons Convention]] comes into force.
*[[1978]] &ndash; Four days before the scheduled opening of Japan's [[Narita International Airport]], a group of protestors destroys much of the equipment in the [[control tower]] with [[Molotov cocktail]]s.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Anwar al-Sadat]], [[Menachem Begin]] and [[Jimmy Carter]] sign the [[Israel-Egypt Peace Treaty]] in [[Washington, D.C.]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; A groundbreaking ceremony for the [[Vietnam Veterans Memorial]] is held in Washington, D.C..
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Argentina]], [[Brazil]], [[Uruguay]] and [[Paraguay]] sign the [[Treaty of Asunción]], establishing [[Mercosur]], the South Common Market.
*  1991   &ndash; Five South Korean boys, nicknamed the [[Frog Boys]], disappear while hunting for frogs and are murdered in a case that remains unsolved.
*  1991   &ndash; [[Local self-government]] is restored after three decades of centralized control in [[South Korea]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; The [[Schengen Treaty]] comes into effect.
*[[1997]] &ndash; Thirty-nine bodies are found in the [[Heaven's Gate (cult)|Heaven's Gate]] [[mass suicide]]s.
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Oued Bouaicha massacre]] in [[Algeria]]: Fifty-two people are killed with axes and knives, 32 of them babies under the age of two.
*[[1999]] &ndash; The "[[Melissa worm]]" infects [[Microsoft]] word processing and e-mail systems around the world.
*  1999   &ndash; A jury in [[Michigan]] finds Dr. [[Jack Kevorkian]] guilty of second-degree [[murder]] for administering a lethal injection to a terminally ill man.
*[[2005]] &ndash; The [[Taiwan]]ese government calls on one million [[Taiwanese people|Taiwanese]] to demonstrate in [[Taipei]], in opposition to the [[Anti-Secession Law of the People's Republic of China]]. Around 200,000 to 300,000 attend the demonstration.
*[[2010]] &ndash; The [[Republic of Korea Navy|ROKS]] [[ROKS_Cheonan_(PCC-772)|''Cheonan'']] [[ROKS_Cheonan_sinking|sinks]] off the west coast of [[South Korea]] near [[Baengnyeong Island]] in the [[Yellow Sea]], killing 46 seamen.
